content: राक्षस {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (सी|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [रक्षस इदं अण्] Belonging to or like an evil spirit, demoniacal, partaking of a demon's nature; मुनयो राक्षसीमाहुर्वाचमुन्मत्तदृप्तयोः <ls>U. 5. 30</ls>, <ls>Bg. 9. 12.</ls> --सः {@--1@} A demon, an evil spirit, a goblin, fiend, imp. {@--2@} One of the eight forms of marriage in Hindu Law, in which a girl is forcibly seized and carried away after the defeat or destruction of her relatives in battle; राक्षसो युद्धहरणात् <ls>Y. 1. 61</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 3. 33</ls> also. (Kṛṣṇa carried away Rukmiṇī in this manner). {@--3@} One of the astronomical {%Yogas%}. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of a minister of Nanda, an important character in the Mudrārākṣasa. {@--5@} A king of the Rākṣasas. --सी {@--1@} A female demon. {@--2@} Laṅkā or Ceylon. {@--3@} Night. {@--4@} A larger tooth, tusk.
